chat.content: An app wants access to my contacts. Should I allow it?
Only allow access if it is necessary for the app to function. If it is optional, deny or limit access. Review permissions regularly and remove ones you do not need.
How can I remove my home address from people-search sites?
Many data brokers have opt-out forms. Start with the largest sites, submit removal requests, and keep records of your submissions. It may take repeated requests over time.
Is it safe to share my location on social media?
Real-time location sharing can create safety risks. If you share, consider posting after you leave and avoid showing home, school, or routine details.
A coworker keeps taking photos of me at work. What should I do?
You can set a boundary and ask them to stop. If it continues, document it and report to your manager or HR. Workplace policies often address consent and privacy.
What is a data broker?
Data brokers collect and sell personal information from various sources. You can reduce exposure by limiting what you share publicly and using opt-out tools where available.
How can I secure my phone?
Use a strong passcode or biometric lock, keep the operating system updated, and enable device encryption. Also review app permissions and enable two-factor authentication for key accounts.
I got a friend request from a stranger. Should I accept?
It is safer not to accept requests from people you do not know. Scammers often use fake profiles. If in doubt, ignore or block.
Is it okay to share my child's school name online?
It is best to avoid sharing identifying details about children, such as school names or schedules. If you post photos, use privacy settings and limit personal information.
My email was hacked. What should I do?
Change your password from a clean device, enable two-factor authentication, and review recent account activity. Revoke unknown sessions and check for forwarding rules you did not set.
Is fingerprint unlock safe?

It is generally convenient and secure for daily use, but it can be less protective in situations where someone could force you to unlock. Consider your risk level and use a strong passcode as a backup.
Work wants to install monitoring software on my personal laptop. Is that okay?
That raises privacy concerns. Ask whether a work device is available or if there are options to separate work and personal data. Review the policy carefully before agreeing.
How do I delete old accounts I no longer use?
Search your inbox for old signup emails, then visit account settings to deactivate or delete. Consider using a password manager to track accounts and verify closures.
I think my ex is tracking my phone. What should I do?

Review location sharing settings and remove any unknown devices or apps. Change account passwords and enable two-factor authentication. If you feel unsafe, reach out to a trusted support service for guidance.
What is doxxing and how can I protect myself?

Doxxing is the public release of private information. You can reduce risk by tightening social media privacy, removing data from broker sites, and limiting what you share online. If doxxed, document and report to platforms.
Can I record video in public?
Laws vary by location. In many places, recording in public is legal, but there can be restrictions. Check local laws and respect others' privacy when possible.
Are smart speakers safe to use?
They can be convenient, but they collect voice data. Review privacy settings, mute the microphone when not in use, and consider where you place the device.
My data showed up in a breach. What should I do?
Change passwords on affected accounts, enable two-factor authentication, and watch for suspicious activity. Consider a credit freeze if sensitive identity data was exposed.
Should I use email aliases for signups?
Yes, aliases can reduce spam and improve privacy. If an alias is compromised, you can disable it without affecting your main email.
How can I share files securely?
Use a reputable cloud service with access controls and expiring links. Avoid sending sensitive files over unencrypted channels.
I found a hidden camera in my rental. What should I do?
Leave the area if you feel unsafe, document what you found, and contact the platform or property manager. You may also want to report it to local authorities. Your safety and privacy come first.
